actor_awards.notes: Frank Thring was a prolific stage and television actor in Australia in addition to his film work. He is often remembered for playing both Pontius Pilate and Herod Antipas, two biblical figures responsible for the trial of Jesus.

filmography.title: Ben-Hur
filmography.role_description: The Roman governor of Judea who oversees the chariot race and ultimately presides over the trial of Christ, portrayed with cynical detachment.
filmography.plot: A Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, but he regains his freedom and returns for revenge.
filmography.awards: Film won 11 Oscars including Best Picture

filmography.title: King of Kings
filmography.role_description: The tetrarch of Galilee who orders the execution of John the Baptist and later questions Jesus during his trial.
filmography.plot: A dramatic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from his birth in Bethlehem to his crucifixion and resurrection.

filmography.title: El Cid
filmography.role_description: The treacherous Moorish Emir of Valencia who plays both sides in the conflict between Christians and Moors in medieval Spain.
filmography.plot: The legendary Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar (El Cid) tries to unite a divided country against the Moorish invaders.

filmography.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome
filmography.role_description: The head of the trade and barter system in Bartertown, a bureaucratic villain who oversees the gladiatorial arena.
filmography.plot: In a post-apocalyptic Australia, Max is exiled from Bartertown and sent into the desert, where he is rescued by a tribe of children.

filmography.title: The Vikings
filmography.role_description: The usurping English King of Northumbria who throws the Viking leader Ragnar into a pit of wolves, sparking a war.
filmography.plot: Einar and Eric are two Viking half-brothers who hate each other but join forces to attack the English kingdom that holds their princess captive.

filmography.title: The Man from Hong Kong
filmography.role_description: A crime lord's henchman involved in the drug trade who clashes with the Hong Kong inspector sent to extradite a suspect.
filmography.plot: A Hong Kong police inspector travels to Sydney to extradite a drug courier and takes on a powerful crime boss.

filmography.title: Mad Dog Morgan
filmography.role_description: A corrupt and sadistic police superintendent who relentlessly pursues the bushranger Dan Morgan.
filmography.plot: The true story of Irish outlaw Dan Morgan, who became a legendary bushranger in colonial Australia.

filmography.title: Age of Consent
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated art dealer who handles the work of the jaded artist protagonist played by James Mason.
filmography.plot: An aging artist seeks inspiration on a remote island on the Great Barrier Reef, where he meets a young muse.

filmography.title: Ned Kelly
filmography.role_description: The real-life judge who sentenced the infamous outlaw Ned Kelly to death, portrayed as a symbol of British colonial authority.
filmography.plot: The story of Australia's most famous outlaw, Ned Kelly, and his conflict with the colonial police force.

filmography.title: Hercules Returns
filmography.role_description: Thring provides the booming, comedic voice of the king of the gods in this redubbed parody of an Italian peplum film.
filmography.plot: A group of cinema employees are forced to improvise a new soundtrack and dialogue for an old Italian Hercules movie when the original track goes missing.

filmography.title: Howling III
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant film director in this horror-comedy sequel about a race of marsupial werewolves in Australia.
filmography.plot: A scientist discovers a tribe of marsupial werewolves in the Australian outback and tries to protect them from the government.

filmography.title: A Question of Adultery
filmography.role_description: A prosecuting barrister in a controversial courtroom drama involving a case of artificial insemination.
filmography.plot: A jealous husband sues for divorce on the grounds of adultery after his wife becomes pregnant through artificial insemination.

filmography.title: Death of a Soldier
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in a historical drama about the trial of an American soldier in WWII Australia.
filmography.plot: The true story of Eddie Leonski, an American GI stationed in Melbourne during WWII who committed a series of murders.

filmography.title: Alvin Rides Again
filmography.role_description: A gangster boss in this sequel to the popular Australian sex comedy 'Alvin Purple'.
filmography.plot: Alvin Purple, a man irresistible to women, gets mixed up with gangsters and accidentally becomes a porn star.

filmography.title: At Last... Bullamakanka: The Motion Picture
filmography.role_description: A television producer in a broad Australian comedy featuring a host of local celebrities.
filmography.plot: A small Australian town is visited by a government official, leading to chaos and musical numbers.

filmography.title: The Flaming Sword
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this British adventure film set in Africa.
filmography.plot: An adventure story involving river pirates and lost treasure in Africa.

filmography.title: Treason
filmography.role_description: A German general in a television play about the plot to assassinate Hitler.
filmography.plot: A dramatic reconstruction of the July 20 plot by German officers to assassinate Adolf Hitler.

filmography.title: The Sentimental Bloke
filmography.role_description: Thring's first screen appearance as a child in a film directed by his father, F.W. Thring.
filmography.plot: A tough larrikin from Melbourne falls in love and tries to go straight in this adaptation of C.J. Dennis's poems.

filmography.title: Bodyline
filmography.role_description: A British aristocrat and cricket administrator in this acclaimed miniseries about the 1932-33 Ashes tour.
filmography.plot: The story of the controversial 'Bodyline' cricket series between England and Australia.
filmography.awards: Logie Awards: Win â€“ Best Miniseries

filmography.title: Against the Wind
filmography.role_description: A colonial magistrate in this historical miniseries about Ireland and Australia.
filmography.plot: A historical drama following an Irish rebel who is transported to New South Wales as a convict.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot the Albatross
filmography.role_description: A judge in a television film exploring the life of Captain Bligh.
filmography.plot: A biographical drama about William Bligh, focusing on his time as Governor of New South Wales.

filmography.title: Death Shock
filmography.role_description: A role in a low-budget horror thriller.
filmography.plot: A thriller involving a series of mysterious deaths.

filmography.title: Outbreak of Love
filmography.role_description: A character in a romantic drama miniseries set in pre-WWI Melbourne.
filmography.plot: A woman finds herself torn between her duty to her husband and her love for a former suitor.

filmography.title: Light Me a Lucifer
filmography.role_description: Thring plays Satan himself in this television play satire.
filmography.plot: The Devil visits Earth to see why hell is becoming overcrowded.

filmography.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
filmography.role_description: A recurring villain who tries to steal Skippy for his private zoo, becoming one of the show's most memorable antagonists.
filmography.plot: The adventures of a young boy and his intelligent pet kangaroo in an Australian national park.
